summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 among FBI and NYPD task force members and a federal prosecutor, discussing investigative steps in the Epstein case. It includes planning to interview a former Epstein associate and her sister, and issuing a subpoena to publicist R. Couri Hay for information about Epstein's statements regarding his conduct.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: A publicist referenced in New York Times stories who had a conversation with Jeffrey Epstein about Epstein's prior conduct and reputation management. The email chain discusses issuing him a subpoena for an interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; referenced as having discussed his prior conduct and reputation with publicist R. Couri Hay, asserting his conviction did not constitute pedophilia.

connections.description: Hay was contacted by Epstein for reputation management/public relations assistance; they discussed Epstein's prior conduct.

events.title: Planning interviews and subpoena for R. Couri Hay
events.description: FBI/NYPD task force members coordinate to interview publicist R. Couri Hay, who had spoken with Epstein, and prepare to serve him a subpoena if he declines an informal interview.

events.title: Planning meeting with former Epstein associate and sister
events.description: Prosecutors request a meeting with a woman who previously worked with Epstein and possibly her younger sister, who may have useful information and may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.

events.title: Epstein's conversation with R. Couri Hay
events.description: Epstein had a conversation with publicist R. Couri Hay about improving his reputation, during which Epstein asserted his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia and the girls were 'tweens and teens.'

keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively investigating Epstein in July 2019, planning to interview a former associate and her sister who may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters.
Publicist R. Couri Hay was a person of interest because he had spoken with Epstein about reputation management and Epstein's prior conduct just months before Epstein's arrest.
Epstein told R. Couri Hay that his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia, characterizing the girls as 'tweens and teens.'
The investigation involved a joint NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document shows the use of subpoenas to compel testimony from reluctant witnesses during the investigation.
